column2: NEBRASKA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who have traditional work schedules.
column10: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 2. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column10: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 3. Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit in a business district is:
4. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column6: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column8: slow down and pass the bus with caution.

column2: 5. If the traffic lights are out of service when you approach an intersection, you:
column6: must slow down and yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: must continue according to the rules of right-of-way.
column10: must come to a stop as you would for a stop sign.

column2: 6. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column8: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 7. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.

column2: 8. Large trucks:
column6: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
column8: do not need more room to maneuver.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers:
column4: turning right on red is forbidden.
column6: they may not turn right or left during the red light.
column8: they must wait for the traffic signal to turn green before turning right or left.

column2: 10. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 11. This road sign:
column4: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.

column2: 12. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
13. This road sign means:
column8: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 14. When the road is slippery you should:
15. This signal means:
16. This road sign means:
column6: The road ahead is closed to traffic

column2: 17. Arrows on the roadway:
column6: show which lanes you must use.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 18. When driving in snow, using your cruise control is safe as long as you reduce your speed.
19. When approaching a stopped school bus with its red lights flashing and its stop arm extended, you must stop and remain stopped until it appears safe to proceed.
20. This road sign means:
21. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights behind you, you should:
column4: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column6: immediately come to a complete stop.
column8: disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
column10: slow down, provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.

column2: 22. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column6: Open the side window so you can see.
column8: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
24. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 25. Signs containing information about hazardous conditions are known as _____ signs.
